contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} {{Orphan|date=February 2009}} '''Automatic message exchange''' (AME): In an adaptive [[high-frequency]] (HF) [[radio network]], an automated process allowing the [[Call transfer|transfer]] of a [[message]] from message injection to addressee reception, without human intervention. Through the use of machine-addressable transport guidance [[information]], ''i.e.,'' the message [[header (information technology)|header]], the message is automatically routed through an on-line direct [[telecommunication connection|connection]] through single or multiple [[transmission (telecommunications)|transmission]] media. Source: from [[Federal Standard 1037C]] [[Category:Radio terminology]]
